question: Who had three daughters?
answer1: a widowed Queen

question: Why was the eldest Princess determined that she would set out into the world to seek her fortune?
answer1: Her family barely had enough to eat.

question: Why did the widowed Queen allow the eldest Princess to set out into the world?
answer1: It was better to work abroad than to starve at home.

question: Where did the old hen-wife live?
answer1: near the Castle

question: Who was said to be a witch and to be able to foretell the future?
answer1: an old-hen wife

question: What did the widowed Queen tell her daughter to do before she set out on her travels?
answer1: ask the old hen-wife in which of the Four Airts she ought to go

question: Why was the old-hen wife glad to help the eldest Princess?
answer1: She always felt very sorry for the Queen and her pretty daughters?

question: What did the eldest Princess see after she peeped out the back door?
answer1: a magnificent coach

question: How did the eldest Princess feel after she saw the magnificent coach?
answer1: excited

question: Why did the second Princess tell her sister to make haste?
answer1: It was waiting for her.

question: What did the eldest Princess do after her sister told her to make haste?
answer1: hurried home, and, saying farewell to her mother and sisters, took her seat within, and the horses galloped off immediately

question: Where did the eldest Princess go to after she got onto the coach?
answer1: the Palace of a great and wealthy Prince

question: What happened after the eldest Princess got onto the coach?
answer1: She got married to a prince.

question: Why did the second Princess want to do the same thing as her eldest sister?
answer1: She hoped that what had happened to her sister would happen to her also.

question: How did the second Princess feel after she saw the coach coming along the road?
answer1: happy

question: Why did the youngest Princess want to find out her fortune?
answer1: Her sisters' fortunes were good.
answer2: She saw how lucky her sisters were.

question: How did the youngest Princess feel while she wanted to find out her fortune?
answer1: anxious

question: What did the youngest Princess expect to see after she opened the door?
answer1: a third coach-and-six

question: How did the youngest Princess feel after she did not see the coach?
answer1: sad

question: What did the youngest Princess see after she opened the door?
answer1: a deserted road

question: What did the youngest Princess need to do after the coach did not come?
answer1: She had to return the next day.
answer2: She needed to come back tomorrow.

question: What will happen after the youngest Princess comes back to the old wife's cottage?
answer1: She will not see the coach.
answer3: She will not have good fortune.

question: What did the youngest Princess see on the third day?
answer1: a great Black Bull

question: How did the youngest Princess feel after she saw the great Black Bull?
answer1: alarmed

question: Why was the youngest Princess alarmed when she saw the great Black Bull?
answer1: It was approaching fiercely.
answer2: She did not expect a bull to come.

question: How did the youngest Princess feel after she found out that the bull was her fate?
answer1: upset

question: Why didn't the youngest Princess want to go with the bull?
answer1: She did not want to accept her fortune.
answer2: She refused to believe that was her fortune.

question: What will the youngest Princess do after the hen-wife says she must go with the bull?
answer1: run weeping to her mother, to beg to be allowed to stay at home

question: Why did the youngest Princess go with the bull?
answer1: She found her mother of the same mind as the Wise Woman.

question: What did the youngest Princess do after the Black Bull set off again on his wild career?
answer1: sobbed and trembled,  with terror, and clung to his horns with all her might

question: Why did the youngest Princess almost fall to the ground?
answer1: The poor maiden was so faint with fear and hunger.

question: What did the Black Bull do when the youngest Princess was losing hold of his horns?
answer1: turned his massive head round a little, and, speaking in a wonderfully soft and gentle voice

question: What did the Black Bull tell the youngest Princess to do after she was about to lose hold of his horns?
answer1: ate out of his right ear, and drank out of his left ear

question: What happened after the youngest Princess put her hand into the Bull's right ear?
answer1: She drew out some bread and meat.

question: What happened after the youngest Princess put her hand into his left ear?
answer1: She found there a tiny flagon of wine.

question: Where did the youngest Princess and the Black Bull go to rest?
answer1: a magnificent Castle

question: Why didn't the youngest Princess reply to the Black Bull when they arrived at his brother's castle?
answer1: She was too tired to wonder very much at anything.

question: What did the Black Bull do after he ushered the youngest Princess into the hall?
answer1: trotted off quite contentedly to the grassy park

question: What did the Lord and his Lady do after the youngest Princess arrived?
answer1: gave her her supper, and led her to a richly furnished bedroom, and left her to rest there

question: What did the Lord and his Lady give to the youngest Princess?
answer1: a beautiful apple

question: What did the Lord and his Lady tell the youngest Princess after they handed her a beautiful apple?
answer1: to break it, but to put it in her pocket, and keep it till she was in the greatest strait that mortal could be in

question: Where did the Black Bull and youngest Princess go to after they continued their journey?
answer1: another Castle

question: What did Lord and Lady of the Castle give to her?
answer1: a pear

question: What did the Lord and Lady of the Castle tell the youngest Princess after they gave her a pear?
answer1: not break it until she was in the direst strait that she had ever been in, and then, if she broke it, it would bring her out of it

question: What did the youngest Princess receive at the Black Bull's youngest brother's castle?
answer1: a most lovely plum

question: What happened after the youngest Princess and the Black Bull left his younget brother's castle?
answer1: There was no fine Castle waiting for them at the end of their journey.

question: How did the youngest Princess feel when they came to a dark, deep glen?
answer1: scared

question: Why did the youngest Princess feel scared?
answer1: The shadows began to lengthen, they came to a dark, deep glen.

question: Why couldn't the youngest Princess go with the Black Bull into the glen?
answer1: The Black Bull had to go in by himself.
answer2: The Black Bull needed to fight a great Spirit of Darkness.

question: Where did the great Spirit of Darkness live?
answer1: in this glen

question: What did the Black Bull tell the youngest Princess to do while he fought the Spirit of Darkness?
answer1: not move until he returned

question: Why couldn't the youngest Princess move until the Black Bull came back?
answer1: The Evil Spirit of the Glen would have her in his power.

question: How will the youngest Princess know what happens to the Black Bull?
answer1: If everything about thee turn blue, then thou wilt know that I have vanquished the Evil Spirit; but if everything about thee turn red, then the Evil Spirit hath vanquished me.

question: How will the youngest Princess feel after the Black Bull left?
answer1: afraid

question: What happened after the Black Bull defeated the Evil Spirit?
answer1: A mystic spell fell upon her.

question: How did the youngest Princess know that the Black Bull defeated the Evil Spirit?
answer1: The landscape turned a deep azure blue.

question: What will happened after the mystic spell falls upon the youngest Princess?
answer1: She will not see the Black Bull.
answer2: The Black Bull will not see her.

question: Why couldn't the Black Bull and the youngest Princess see each other?
answer1: The spell hindered the both of them.
answer2: The spell prevented them from seeing each other.

question: Why did the youngest Princess still wait for the Black Bull on the stone?
answer1: She did not see him come out of the glen.

question: Why did the youngest Princess start crying?
answer1: She became so wearied, and lonely, and frightened.

question: Why did the youngest Princess walk away from the stone?
answer1: She felt that it was no use sitting there any longer.

question: How did the youngest Princess feel after she could not find the Black Bull?
answer1: scared

question: What did the youngest Princess do after she came to a great hill?
answer1: tried time after time to climb it

question: Why couldn't the youngest Princess climb the great hill?
answer1: The surface of the hill was so slippery,

question: Why did the youngest Princess begin to walk around the bottom of the hill?
answer1: She hoped to find another path.
answer2: She wanted to find another way.

question: Where did the youngest Princess go after she could not climb over the hill?
answer1: a little cottage

question: Why did the youngest Princess feel like it was a hopeless quest?
answer1: The hill was so big, and she was so tired.

question: Who was working at his anvil?
answer1: an old smith

question: What did the youngest Princess do after she approached the old smith?
answer1: asked him if he could tell her of any path that would lead her over the mountain

question: Why was it hard for folk men to walk around the Mountain of Glass?
answer1: The foot of it stretched out for hundreds of miles, and the folk who tried to do so were almost sure to lose their way.

question: What did the youngest Princess need to walk over the top of the Mountain of Glass?
answer1: iron shoon

question: Why did the youngest Princess suddenly stop after asking to pay for the iron shoon?
answer1: She remembered that she had no money.

question: What did the youngest Princess have to do to get the iron shoon?
answer1: serve the old man

question: What did the youngest Princess do for seven years?
answer1: cleaned his house, and cooked his food, and made and mended his clothes

question: Why did the youngest Princess accept the old man's offer?
answer1: There seemed nothing else for it.

question: Where did the youngest Princess go to after she descended the summit?
answer1: the house of an old washerwoman

question: What did the youngest Princess need to do to stay at the old washerwoman's house?
answer1: wash a white mantle that the Black Knight of Norroway had brought to her

question: Who was an exceeding great and powerful Prince?
answer1: Black Knight of Norroway

question: How will the youngest Princess feel after she heard about the Black Knight of Norroway?
answer1: excited

question: Why did the Black Knight of Norroway turn into a Black Bull?
answer1: The Black Knight chanced to have a spell thrown over him.

question: What did the Black Knight of Norroway need to do to regain his true form?
answer1: fight with, and overcome, a mighty Spirit of Evil that lived in a dark glen

question: Why was the Black Knight of Norroway's mind clouded at times?
answer1: He lost his maiden.
answer2: He could not find his maiden.

question: What happened after the youngest Princess washed the mantle?
answer1: As soon as she put it into water the stains vanished, and it became as white and clean as when it was new.

question: How will the old woman feel after the youngest Princess washes out the stains?
answer1: delighted

question: Why did the old woman advise the Princess to go to bed early?
answer1: She wanted her daughter to get the credit of washing it.

question: Why did the Black Knight of Norroway try to finish a miaden who could wash his mantle?
answer1: It had been revealed to him by a wise woman that she who could make it white and clean was destined to be his wife.

question: Who did the Black Knight of Norroway believe washed the mantle?
answer1: the washerwoman's daughter

question: How did the youngest Princess feel after she heard the Black Knight was going to marry someone else?
answer1: sad

question: What will happen after the youngest Princess becomes distressed?
answer1: She will think about the apple.
answer2: She will remember to use the apple.

question: What happened after the youngest Princess broke the apple?
answer1: It was filled with the most beautiful precious stones that she had ever.

question: Why did the youngest Princess offer the precious stones to the washerwoman?
answer1: The youngest Princess needed to bribe her.
answer2: The youngest Princess wanted to delay the wedding.

question: Why did the washerwoman accept the youngest Princess's offer?
answer1: It would make her rich for life.

question: What did the old washerwoman do after she took the youngest Princess's offer?
answer1: She had made up her mind that she would give the Black Knight a sleeping-draught.

question: Why did the old washerwoman give the Black Knight a sleeping-draught?
answer1: It would effectually prevent him as much as speaking to this strange maiden.

question: What did the youngest Princess do when she came into the Black Knight's apartment?
answer1: watched all through the long hours by his bedside, singing this song to him in the hope that he would awake and hear it

question: Why did the youngest Princess sing to the Black Knight?
answer1: in the hope that he would awake and hear it

question: Why didn't the Black Knight listen to the youngest Princess?
answer1: The old washerwoman used a potion on him.
answer2: The potion made sure he would not wake up.

question: What did the youngest Princess do after the Black Knight wouldn't wake up?
answer1: broke open the pear

question: Why did the youngest Princess bribe the old woman again?
answer1: The Black Knight did not wake up last night.
answer2: She wanted another chance to talk to the Black Knight.

question: What will happen after the youngest Princess tries to talk to the Black Knight on the second night?
answer1: He will not wake up.
answer2: She will fail to wake him up.

question: Why did the youngest Princess almost lose hope?
answer1: There was only the plum remaining now, and if that failed her last chance had gone.

question: How did the Princess feel after she realized she only had one chance left?
answer1: anxious

question: What did the youngest Princess do after she failed to wake up the Black Knight on the second night?
answer1: broke the plum open, and found inside another collection of precious stones

question: Why was the Black Knight tired of waiting for his wedding?
answer1: His wedding was getting delayed.

question: Who heard the youngest Princess sing at night?
answer1: an old huntsman

question: What did the Black Knight do after the washerwoman left to fetch some honey?
answer1: jumped out of bed and poured it all out of the window

question: Why did the Black Knight pretend to drink the sleeping-draught of spiced ale?
answer1: The huntsman told him to not drink it.
answer2: The Black Knight wanted to hear the singing.

question: What happened after the Black Knight stayed awake at night?
answer1: He heard the Princess enter his room, and listened to her plaintive little song.

question: How did the Black Knight feel after he found the youngest Princess?
answer1: happy

question: Why did the Black Knight become angry at the washerwoman and her daughter?
answer1: They lied to him.
answer2: They hid the truth from him.

question: What did the Black Knight do after he heard the whole story?
answer1: ordered them to leave the country at once
